page.title: 08Upper Otter Valley:People 1
page.content: 1 A glance at the O.S.map shows that the area is thinly populated,though some of the farms may be a cluster of dwellings,sheltering more than one household.About half the inhabitants are local people,whose families have been in this district for several generations,though not necessarily at the same farm.During the last twenty years there has been a steady influx of middle-class people from the towns. Many of these are retired couples; but luckily the village still boasts its school,so that young families do still settle in the valley.Good road connections with the neighbouring towns make it possible for a young professional to live in rural peace and commute to work by car.
